review_text: Amos’ place was as described, in a safe neighborhood with plenty of parking and a great value if looking for a comfy bed for a weekend visit to Durham. Also nice was that my friend was able to bring her pup. The apartment was free of dog hair even though it is pet friendly. The place was well stocked with thoughtful conveniences such as bug spray, doggie bags and Q-tips. Thanks Amos!

It’s the perfect location to be right next to downtown, but also far enough to have quiet and privacy.

As for we humans, the bed was comfortable, the AC nice and cool, and the couch comfy for working and watching shows. It's a great value.

review_text: Amos was a great host! He was very responsive before booking when I had questions about his pet policy. He was also very helpful and flexible when I realized last minute that I'd made a mistake with my original booking. The place was exactly as described and his instructions/information was very clear and helpful. The place itself was cute and cozy and perfect for what I needed. His place was very pet friendly with bowls, a big dog bed, waste bags, cleaning supplies, towels, and blankets for my dogs. Everything was clearly labeled so I knew what could or couldn't be used for them too (towels/blankets/etc). My dogs loved his big fenced-in backyard which was the biggest perk!

review_text: This place was just what we needed for our 2-3 day stay in Durham. It was easy to access, in close proximity to downtown areas, comfortable, private, and quiet. All the amenities were there and it was convenient having a washer/dryer, and other little extras. We had our cat stay with us, and she was super comfortable there. It was clean, with the exception of a little pet hair, which is understandable when you're hosting pets. The house is on the older side, and perhaps needs a little TLC. The shower was quite tight and uncomfortable. These were the only downsides (but I might also be slightly pickier than most people) and easy to overlook because this apartment overall was great. And Amos was friendly and very responsive!

I would definitely recommend this Airbnb and I am sure I will be back the next time business brings me back to the Durham area.

It was good for us because we truly just needed a dog friendly spot where we could shower and rest our heads. The yard was perfect for our dogs to have some space to roam off leash and the space was great for our dogs inside as they don’t require much room. They just sleep in their beds when we aren’t around. Everything was as described. Just like other air bnbs you don’t know the cleaning required of you until you already have the spot. We were asked to strip the bed and start the load of laundry as well as clean any used dishes. Amos was helpful before, during, and after our trip with any questions/needs/concerns! Excellent host!! This place fill all of our needs for our trip.

review_text:
So happy to have found this Airbnb! Amos's place was close, convenient, and a fantastic deal for the price. We were in town for a night to see Wicked, and after paying for our tickets we didn't want to spend a ton on lodging, so this was a perfect find. A mile walk to the theater meant no paying for parking, and allowed us to explore all that downtown had to offer.
Amos was quick to respond, easy to talk to, and very accommodating. Check-in was a breeze and a few extra touches (water bottles in the fridge for us, Cliff and Kind bars for a little snack, the TV access) were much appreciated! Would definitely stay here again in the future.

review_text:
I recently stayed at Amos' Airbnb in Durham, NC and it was a fantastic experience. The space was cozy and clean, making it the perfect home base for exploring the city. The location was great, with easy access to everything Durham has to offer.
Communication with Amos was top-notch - he was always quick to respond and made sure we had everything we needed for a comfortable stay. He also provided us with great recommendations for things to do and see in Durham, which really made our trip.
One of the highlights of the Airbnb was the fantastic shower - it was the perfect way to unwind after a day of exploring the city. We also loved having a fridge and coffee maker in the room, which made it easy to enjoy a quick breakfast before heading out for the day.
Overall, I would highly recommend Amos' Airbnb to anyone looking for a comfortable and convenient place to stay in Durham.

Pleasant touches like books and vinyl records make it and easygoing place to lounge during downtime or between activities.
A word of warning: We were woken up by a series of blaring freight train horns on both weekend days as trains approached the railroad crossing up the street. Light sleepers and late-risers beware.

Rating, 5 stars
,
·
February 2022
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text: This is an outstanding loft apartment ideally located so close to many fun spots in Downtown Durham--DPAC, restaurants, coffee shops & retail. The apartment itself is sparkling clean, comfortable queen bed, nice walk in closet with full length mirrors, nice open kitchen with all appliances: stove/oven, microwave, refrig/freezer, dishwasher, dishware & utensils, Keurig machine w/pods as well as some snacks--such a nice touch! Decorated so cool with interesting curated pieces of furniture and art. Wonderful books, puzzles and records (yes, there is even a working record player). Plenty of natural light streaming in, especially in the early evening. Nice for just sitting around before going out for the evening. Rachael is terrific at communicating. To my surprise, she got in touch with me the morning I was leaving to go over all the instructions for parking and getting in. After I had been there a couple of hours, she even came back during a working day for her, to get me back in after I accidentally locked myself out (instead of trusting my instincts to trust the code she gave me, I locked the door from the inside)--worried more about me when I was the one incoveniencing her. She couldn't have been more lovely and accommodating. I will definitely stay here next time I'm in Durham. Great place and outstanding service. Thank you Rachael.

As a host, Rachael is kind, prompt, and provides excellent recommendations for things to do while in Durham. Do yourself a favor and book immediately for your special moments, your staycations, or just to treat yourself.

Looking for a restful stay in a tiny house in the woods? But also want to be close to the city? This is your spot.
The woods are so peaceful. The house? Fully stocked like a resort! Everything you need is considered. Enough towels? Check! Qtips and floss picks? Check! Fully stocked kitchen? Yes!
PLUS - you'll get coffee beans, grinder, pour over AND french press, gourmet creamer. Oh! And did I mention the honor bar? Comfy bed with awesome sheets you just sink into? Ahhhh, it was wonderful.
If you’re considering this place, just do it!

review_text:
The hubby and I booked this airbnb for a mini-staycation to connect and relax. This airbnb felt like a home away from home and looked exactly as advertised.
As foodies, we were very surprised to have pour over coffee and French press coffee at our reach - including fresh local coffee beans, grinDer, and digital scale (things that we never bring, so we were so excited to make good coffee during out stay.
The kitchen is full stocked with essentials - pots, pans, base condiments, and more. Part of relaxing this weekend included making kimbap. If I had known there was so many kitchen essentials, I probably could have packed lighter and left certain items at home.
Riley and Gabby were very attentive and gave us stellar recommendations for dinner one night. Their guidebook is stellar, full of fun places to eat within 10 min from the location.
While it's winter, I did enjoy the screened porch and admired the natural surroundings at this tiny home.
We plan to stay here again!

review_text: An absolute gem of a find! I want this house! My stay with my pup was unforgettable and perfection! Minutes from everything and some extra tasty eats, yet it's a tranquil escape at the same time. The amenities were perfect - a fully equipped kitchen, laundry, A/C, and high-speed internet. The screened-in porch is basically the best outdoor living room in existence. The bed was sooo comfy. The kitchen felt like being right at home. I actually REALLY enjoyed the no TV element. They also pointed me to great and very well maintained walking trail at the end of their road where I enjoyed morning walks and evening runs with my pup, even saw a few deer. Also, their commitment to inclusivity and planting a tree for each visit is commendable. My stay was a delightful escape, and I'm already planning my next visit with a friend. If you want a unique and peaceful getaway, this is the place to be. Five stars for both the hosts and the home!

I could just say, “don’t hesitate to book the tiny house”…but that wouldn’t begin to emphasize how truly restorative the experience was.
Getting to the house was very comprehensive. The entrance and surroundings were giving “suburban tropical oasis”. The front porch is the cutest and perfect for yoga during the day and quaint dining during the evening. The kitchen had everything that I needed to make quick meals (I made a very impressive stove top pizza!) and the bathroom was very spacious and luxurious. The loft bedroom was very cozy. I really appreciated that all of the light and ceiling fan fixtures are labeled so I didn’t have to guess where to adjust the lights & fan. The hosts were very responsive and gave great recommendations for hiking and dining. They also gave a little “thank you” box of toffees that I delighted in when I got home later. :) This was a truly relaxing stay!

review_text:
The tiny house is an absolute gem. My dog and I stayed here for 4 nights and we would return without a doubt. Riley and Gaby’s home is the perfect mixture of being close to things while still feeling pleasantly secluded. And I mean, if that porch doesn’t convince you to stay here then I don’t know what will.
Their house looked exactly like it did in the pictures—if not better in person. The property was clean, thoughtfully appointed and designed, and had all the amenities one might need. And as promised, the bed and sheets were top quality.
Riley and Gaby are the epitome of ideal hosts and both went above and beyond to ensure that our stay was a comfortable and welcoming one. They went the extra mile as hosts and it showed, which makes this an easy recommendation for me.
Thanks for sharing your home with us!

review_text:
Pretty Vacant is an incredible space! We stayed for my niece’s graduation and didn’t want to leave. It was the perfect place for my family to gather for a glass of wine and so incredibly charming. And, the wine bar and staff downstairs is so cute and inviting.
One thing to note is that the back patio of the wine bar is noisy (music and people chatting like the should be) until 12am on a Saturday night. It didn’t bother us upstairs because the music was sooo good and we weren’t going to bed early. But, if you are sensitive to sound or need to go to bed early, bring some ear plugs. Either way, it was 200% worth it.
Would stay here again and again.
And Sylvia had everything dialed in and is so responsive and easy-going.

name: Todd
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2023
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
Once in a blue moon, you discover an AirBnB space so remarkable, so compelling, and so special, that you hesitate when it comes to sharing it with the whole wide world. Pretty Vacant is one such place.
For starters, it's named for a Sex Pistols song - that alone cranks up the hip factor exponentially. It's also located directly above an amazing wine bar and equally compelling record store. And it features a classic turntable, excellent sound system and an amazing collection of records to choose from during your stay. Indeed, we made good use of all of these resources during our stay.
Exquisite attention and care have gone into decorating Pretty Vacant, and the owner's love of the arts is apparent in every nook and cranny. We easily could have spent the night simply relaxing and relishing in Pretty Vacant's aura. In truth, we might return someday and do just that.
Silvia & Lindsay have curated a remarkable "experience." It's a space like no other, and worth your attention.

BEST IN DURHAM!!! Wow, cannot say enough about this place and how lovely it was. I am already planning my next trip!
Absolutely gorgeous apartment, with the comfiest bed, and a beautiful space to hang and relax, or perfect for entertaining a group. This would be perfect for a dinner with family and friends- it has everything you need to host a group. I was by myself and it still felt cozy and intimate.
The towels were the softest I've ever felt! The design is both warm and inviting, but also fun and joyful. Silvia is the ultimate host and was incredibly easy to contact if any need arises. And you can pop down to the wine bar below for the best Chocolate Chip Cookie of your life! Can't wait to return.

review_text: Lindsay and Silvia's place was unforgettable and the most beautiful and unique Airbnb we have ever stayed in. We are super host ourselves and we were incredibly impressed with how immaculate the place was. They really went above and beyond and made us feel so welcomed and right at home from the moment we got there. The place is even bigger than we thought and the decor is out of this world it felt like we were celebrities staying here. Every thing we looked at had an elevated sense of style, art and intentionality that only a true interior artist can achieve and we felt we had found a gem that needs to be showcased in a TV show show where- You will not find any like this place any where else for the price. It was was an unforgettable stay and our memories here with our friends will last forever. Everyone fell in love with our airbnb and we can wait to come back to visit!

This place is incredibly beautiful and set up for a successful stay in Durham or to host a few friends. It has everything you need to host a small gathering and it has the most comfortable beds. The bathrooms are pristine, the fridge starts you off with some bread, butter, sparkling water and wine; You really do feel right at home. It’s right above one of the best wine bars in Durham and you can’t even tell ( noise wise). You can hear loud cars pass by if you’re sitting in the living room but that’s to be expected considering the amazing location.
All in all this is a great spot and highly recommend it.

November 2023
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text: Robert and Andrea were incredibly hospitable and kind. Their condo was ideally located for us, within easy distance of family members and downtown destinations. It's a lovely walking neighborhood, too. They were also very flexible, as we had an emergency during our stay, about checkout procedures and times. They anticipated touches that were helpful during our stay, from providing Saran Wrap to leaving Kleenex and toiletries for our use. I'd add a light, breathable (not polyester) blanket for that intermediary layer between the sheets and comforter, for visitors who like to sleep cooler. Perhaps a few hangers for skirts/pants? Glad to be able to bring our Pomeranian, Ted, on the trip; perhaps warn pet owners that dogs have to be taken out of the complex for all pee breaks (I might have missed this in your guidelines.) We hope we can stay with you again, particularly in pool-side weather. Thank you both again for your kindness and support.

On the ground floor so there are no stairs, easy parking, excellent short walk to downtown Durham dining and nightlife. We had a minor problem w/ the lock and our host was immediately responsive. There's a nice pool, lovely outdoor spaces, and pleasant neighbors. Kind of like going to a spa, but much less expensive :)

I am a clean and respectful person & always do my best to leave a place better than I arrived but to make it seem mandatory for you to clean with such a high fee doesn't seem fair. Hopefully the fee is lowered for the following guests or the cleaning demands are changed to respectful suggestions. I would stay here again and do recommend, just note the high cleaning fee and cleaning requirements.

The location of the condo is great! Great security and walking distance from great restaurants (Geer street garden, monuts), coffee shops (cocoa cinnamon) and breweries (full steam, motor co) just to name a few. The house itself is fantastic and has all amenities I needed including some basic drink supplies like coffee and water. It also features a courtyard that is a near paradise, complete with a pool, plenty of garden space and relaxing areas, a hammock, life size chess, an artificial stream, herb garden, birds chirping everywhere. It’s an incredible getaway and I wouldn’t stay anywhere else in Durham if this is available.

Make SURE you stop at Rofhiwa Book Cafe (it's walkable!) and enjoy a good cup of coffee and check out the amazing collection of Black books! Communication with Gail was great, she provided lots of helpful information, and she was very flexible with my work schedule which was greatly appreciated.

review_text:
This was my first time in North Carolina. I visited Durham for a week of leisure, and I'm so glad that I did. My week long stay in the Tiny-ish Urban Oasis was nothing short of phenomenal.
I received a warm, friendly greeting from Ms. Gail upon my arrival.
The communication was pleasant. She responded in a timely manner to my questions, which is greatly appreciated.
Upon my arrival, there was some infrastructure work being done in front of her house by the city, which was blocking the usual parking. Ms. Gail kindly offered a temporary parking alternative.
I was impressed. The Tiny-ish Urban Oasis is exactly as pictured and described. It is charming, clean, nicely decorated, and spacious.
After long days of exploring the city, I was able to return to the Tiny-ish house and comfortably relax.
I will definitely stay again when visiting the Durham area and will highly recommend it to others.
The Tiny-ish Urban Oasis was truly my home away from home for the week.

name: Rachel
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
January 2023
,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text:
I loved staying at the Tiny-ish House. I have always wanted to try Tiny living and was able to take advantage of Gail's hospitality for a time. I love that I was left to myself but any need was taken care of. I had my own walkway, yard, and home! I liked that I could cook and eat in the kitchen/living room space with the television. It has Netflix and you can log in to your own streaming accounts as well. The bathroom is the perfect size and the shower is a nice standup. I never had hot water issues. The bedroom was so nice with ample storage.
The location is just like the description- it is close to Golden Belt and downtown! But I loved being half a block from the lovely historic East Durham neighborhood jewel of Rofhiwa bookstore (great coffee and hot chocolate)! I really got to know the neighbors. Everyone is so nice.
As someone with a disability I highly recommend the Tiny-ish House. There are three small steps to get up into the yard but everything else is flat.

I was at Duke Divinity (west campus) for the week and this spot is perfect…less than 10 minutes from everything. Beautiful and ultra clean house with nice amenities and decor (and the bed is super comfy). In a great neighborhood with easy close street parking.

I will be staying here again for all of the rest of my residential weeks!!

review_text:
I would stay in this pristine property again without a second thought! Looked brand new, everything worked as described and it is furnished nicely and thoughtfully.
I love love love the location - very quiet (I am quite noise sensitive), but a straightforward walk down 9th St to restaurants and businesses in Old West Durham. A fantastic breakfast spot "Monuts" is a one minute walk! In general, great location for getting around.
On property, I really appreciated how thoughtfully appointed this townhome is. The kitchen had everything to make full meals (although I did not take advantage of that on this trip) and there is a pleasant lounging and dining area that felt just right.
Upstairs two bedroom suites and laundry closet (I used the washer and dryer and they were quiet, great quality appliances). The nice bonus was my bedroom suite's walk in closet so I could put my luggage out of the way.
Further, Joshua was a great host with a very responsive and cordial communication. A+++++!

name: Rick
rating_info:

,

Stayed about a week
review_text: Super clean, spacious, uncluttered newer townhome. Within walking distance to some fabulous restaurants (Monuts is a must!). Kitchen easy to work in with basic utensils. Living area spacious with a big comfortable couch an extra chair. Beds were comfortable; bathrooms well stocked with fun little amenities and plenty of towels that were fluffy and absorbent. Good hot water supply with good water pressure in the showers one of which is also a tub. Full size washer dryer definitely a plus along with the laundry pods. Quiet home, part of a townhouse, duplex style. Can’t comment on noise from next-door as no one was renting at the time. There is a house next-door that obviously rents to college students who would gather on the weekend evenings, but was never a problem, noise wise, while we were there. moderate traffic and pedestrian activity outside, but clearly of the neighborhood variety and not unreasonably loud at all. Host was super proactive and communicative. We had an issue with the door lock on our first day, and he sent someone out to fix.

review_text: William is a super-duper host!! He went above and beyond what most folks would do. I had a family emergency and need to extended my stay. I was waiting to hear from the hospital as to when my father may undergo surgery. During this wait, I lost William's place to someone who did a quick reservation (doesn't need host approval). I got the news as I was sitting next to my very sick father in the hospital. As this was our first time in North Carolina, I wasn't sure what to do and panicked a little. As I was frantically trying to book another place, William contacted me to let me know he pleaded my case to AirBnB and the new reservation was canceled and I was able to extend my stay. This proved to be a lifesaver for my parents and me. Not only is William's place immaculate, beautifully decorated and furnished, it was also an ideal location for all of our wedding then hospital trips. I will be forever grateful to William for his kindness, patience, support and amazing hospitality.

Unfortunately, there was ongoing construction next door during our stay, so a lack of privacy from construction workers limited our ability to use the backyard and roof deck - totally out of William’s control, and he kindly reached out to ensure our stay was as comfortable as possible. I will note, if you have a nervous dog (like we do) that you are planning on bringing, they may not fare well with the construction noise, so I would recommend checking in with William about the status of the construction before booking! Otherwise, I highly recommend this spot and would absolutely stay here again. Thanks, William!

review_text: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here. William’s house was as described and pictured—it’s modern, clean, and comfy. It had all the conveniences like extra towels, blankets, and toiletries. The kitchen was well stocked with all the basic essentials and cookware. The back porch and rooftop patio were a huge plus. There was some construction going on next door, but I didn’t have any issues during my stay. William was great—he reached out to ensure I was enjoying my stay and communicated about the construction prior to my arrival. The location was great—you’re just minutes from downtown and plenty of great restaurants/bars/breweries. The neighborhood as a whole was a little scruffy, like many areas undergoing regeneration, but it wouldn’t deter me from staying here again. Overall, a positive experience!

Having stayed in several short term rentals during the two months I was in Durham, I have to say the natural light in Taylor and Dylan’s vacation rental property was the best, which is something that is important to me. Also, I enjoyed the proximity to restaurants downtown. The property was perfect for myself and one guest as it has two bedrooms and two baths. The master does not have a closet but there are several wall hangers for clothes.
Taylor and Dylan were immediately responsive to my inquiries which I very much appreciated. All in all, it was the perfect place for me to recuperate during a difficult time. Thank you Taylor and Dylan.

Always interested to see what they’ve done with their properties. Very impressed!

Rating, 5 stars

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
PROS: Absolutely loved this house! It's in a great location and looks exactly like the pictures. The bed and couch were comfortable and the living area had natural light. It's tucked away and was very peaceful at night. It's in the heart of downtown so it's easy to walk to bars & restaurants. We LOVED the list of bars & restaurants the hosts provided!
CONS: The heat doesn't reach the primary bedroom as well so you may have to turn up the heat a bit higher at night. The shower in the primary doesn't get very hot. The water filter was also expired, slight oversight.
When I initially reached out about the possibility of an early check-in or at least some flexibility around the standard check-in time, I was met with a rigid response stating that it was not possible due to cleaning schedules. However there were no guests for the 4 days prior to our stay. I was disappointed with the lack of accommodation and service but overall happy with the property. We would definitely book again!

The photos are amazing, but it does manage to look even better inside. I would definitely recommend this location to others.

Washer/Dryer and dishwasher. Also, they thought of little touches like coffee and sugar, oilve oil, salt and pepper, etc. A real gem. The neighborhood is totally walkable. One of us had a meeting at the main library and we were thrilled to realize it was literally around the corner. All in all, a great stay.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: I could live in Taylor & Dylan's place. Seriously. The accommodations were 5-star. So many things made it perfect for me & my family. It's now #1 place I'll look for when I'm in Durham. This place felt spacious and healthy: linens & towels free of harmful chemicals; white towels that smelled clean (people try to protect the color in colored towels by not using hot water and those towels often smell funky covered with fragrance); quality stainless steel cookware (not the scratched up, cheap teflon coated stuff in so many airbnbs); comfy mattresses and pillows; tons of natural light; a couple of windows with screens so you could get fresh air. Beautifully designed & decorated, wonderful porch, nestled among trees, nice privacy fence. The location was super convenient to downtown and everywhere I needed to be in town. Taylor & Dylan knocked it out of the park.

So many squirrels and birds in the tall trees that surrounded the private little home up the driveway, made it feel private and cozy. They really put a lot of love into this place to make it look beautiful. The only thing I missed was having an actual work space. Two people working on the dinning room table for 2 weeks wasn't ideal, but we made it work. Also, although the livingroom furniture was beautiful it wasn't actually comfortable for watching TV when we wanted to relax. Communication was great and fast, although it seemed like we were always communicating with someone different. That said, I would definitly recommend it and would definitly be back.

review_text: I enjoyed my stay here! It is the bottom of a two story duplex type house. I have nothing bad to say about the house, and location was great. One thing I would say is the neighbors above are very loud due to the wooden floors, you could hear their every move. Overall great stay and I would definitely come back!

rating_info:

,
·
March 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Many reviews have highlighted the great location, communications, cleanliness, and attention to detail of this airbnb, all of which I found true. This is a basement apartment with easy parking, nice spaces inside and out, and very close to much of what I wanted to do. The one thing I learned that I didn't see mentioned in other reviews, is that the many cool metal pieces of art and furniture inside and out result from Jackie being a welder! She recommended a fun place she used to work - Cricket Forge - which I visited and really enjoyed! She and her husband have worked hard to make this place personal and special.

name: Mary
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
February 2023
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
Jackie’s place is well situated in Durham. The neighborhood is beautiful. Her place is on a busy street but well protected with a good fence. The outdoor space is great, a nice deck as you walk out the door. Parking is convenient just outside the door and down the steps.
There are a number of restaurants within a mile or so. You are near the Duke campus, and there is a park just a few minutes away, walking.
There were snacks and a number of additional products such as toiletries available for my use. This was very nice and special and generous. Everything that I needed was there plus more.
Jackie was super attentive to details and offered to get me whatever I needed.
Jackie helped me adjust my dates and was always available for any questions. I needed a carrot peeler and she brought me one right away. It was a nice, super sharp one.
The Airbnb is located below Jackie and her family’s home. It was a very nice, quiet and comfortable space.

Rating, 4 stars
,
·
July 2022
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text: Such a quiet and calm environment with beautiful outdoor seating! It is a lower level apartment with the host above, she is extremely helpful and very responsive. When you first walk in it smells kinda of vintage but you get used to it, there are two air purifiers that work amazing. The bed was very comfy and I even took a nap on the couch it was comfy as well! The apartment was very well stocked plus I did wash a load of clothes. Super cute bathroom, the shower was a little small but worked fine for me just had to get used to it! I had some trouble sleeping because my dogs were reactive (barking/upset) towards the dogs upstairs just walking around or playing late at night. So if you have a reactive or high alert dog keep that in mind!! Overall a really great host, great living space, and would definitely return again!

review_text: My husband and I were in town for the weekend to attend a show at the Durham Preforming Arts Center. The Bird’s Nest was the perfect location! It was near DPAC, many great restaurants, and parks. The apartment had wonderful amenities for a short stay. The hosts provided complimentary snacks and an assortment of toiletries in case you forget anything. The WiFi was fast, and Netflix was provided on both TVs. Our golden retriever traveled with us as well, and The Bird’s Nest was very pet friendly. Communication with Jacqueline was detailed and informative. We fell in love with Durham and will definitely stay at The Bird’s Nest the next time we’re in town!

review_text: Though there’s been great attention given to small touches, when you enter the home there is a distinct, malodorous smell. They try to mask with a very strong, floral scent. The furnace for the house is located in the bedroom, so it is noisy at night.

review_text: Jaqueline’s place was the ideal location for our quick overnight trip to Durham. It’s located within a quick drive to many lovely restaurants and shops. There’s a lovely deck right outside the door where we got to soak up some sun. Jaqueline was communicative and responded to all messages promptly and even allowed us to do an early check-in when we got to town sooner than expected. The apartment was clean and tidy for our arrival. My only issue was that the bed wasn’t the most comfortable for me because I have some problems with my joints and it seemed to be exacerbated by the bed. It might be something to consider if you’re a person with similar challenges. Overall it was a great stay and I would definitely recommend!!

,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text: Our stay at The Bird’s Nest was great! The original plan was to use it as a place to crash while exploring Durham for the rest of the weekend, but we were snowed in for most of our trip. Thankfully, this was a great space to be snowed in to! We had everything we needed- and more. This was the first Airbnb I have stayed in that provided so many things to do (crossword puzzles, sudoku, magazines), and so many “in case you forgot” (cotton balls, band aids, floss, and even a face mask!) items. The towels were fluffy and plentiful! I would definitely recommend this spot to anyone visit the Raleigh Durham area.
